meanings.definition: Beat severely with a stick or whip.
meanings.sent1: The bully drubbed the poor boy with a stick.
meanings.sent2: The farmer drubbed the rug to get rid of the dust.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat drubbed the curtains with its tail.
meanings.sent4: The storm drubbed the windows with rain and wind.
meanings.sent5: The drummer drubbed the rhythm on the drums.

meanings.definition: Defeat decisively in a competition or contest.
meanings.sent1: The champion drubbed his opponent in the final match.
meanings.sent2: The team drubbed their rivals in the soccer game.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox drubbed the hare in the race by taking a shortcut.
meanings.sent4: The sun drubbed the clouds, shining brightly in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher drubbed the students in the spelling bee with challenging words.
